Hey Jeff,

Although the input nodes have an activation function, the activation
functions are activated after the activation has been accumulated, so the
activation functions on the input nodes do not have a chance to kick in.

Now that you mention it, there is a bug where if you are running a
recurrent network or you run for too many iterations, the activation
functions will run on input nodes.  This is probably unnecessary.

Jason G.

--f46d0407116772837c04cba7f7c8
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
